metadata.title: CVE-2015-5245 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - low.
metadata.description: CRLF injection vulnerability in the Ceph Object Gateway (aka radosgw or RGW) in Ceph before 0.94.4 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary HTTP headers and conduct HTTP response splitting attacks via a crafted bucket name.

criterions.comment: ceph package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '10.2.2-0ubuntu5').
